data.title: The Arts Council / An Chomhairle Eala√≠on
data.meta_description: The Arts Council / An Chomhairle Eala√≠on is the national agency for funding, developing and promoting the arts in Ireland.
data.text:
Search by region:

Region 1: Border (Cavan, Donegal, Leitrim, Monaghan & Sligo)

Region 2: West (Galway, Mayo & Roscommon)

Region 3: Midlands (Laois, Longford, Offaly & Westmeath)

Region 4: Mid-East (Kildare, Louth, Meath & Wicklow)

Region 5: Dublin

Region 6: South East (Carlow, Kilkenny, Waterford & Wexford)

Region 7: South West (Cork & Kerry)

Region 8: Mid-West (Clare, Limerick & Tipperary)

Back to Top

Region 1: Border (Cavan, Donegal, Leitrim, Monaghan & Sligo)

Mary Farrelly

Mary is a choreographer, dance and drama facilitator. Her practice focuses on programming for children and young people in a variety of theatre, community and education settings. She is currently working as a youth theatre and special needs drama facilitator at the Ramor Theatre.

Email: maryfarrelly@gmail.com

Schools: Crosskeys National School, Cavan (2021); Holy Family School, Cavan (2021); Kilmore Central N.S, Cavan (2021); Scoil Mhuire Lacken, Cavan (2021); St Mary's National School, Leitrim (2021); St. Patrick's College, Cavan (2021)Royal School Cavan (2020); Deravoy NS, Emmyvale, Monaghan (2020); Knockconan NS, Emmyvale (2020).

Back to Top

Laura Ferguson

Laura has worked as an artist/educator across visual arts disciplines, specialising in ceramics. Her work is sculptural, decorative or site-specific. Exhibitions: New Designers, London and Independents, Liverpool Biennial Contemporary Arts Festival. Her limited edition collections are based on playful pattern, with an emphasis on the handmade.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (Use FAO Laura Ferguson as the subject)

Schools: St Ernans N.S, Donegal (2021); Scoil Naomh Brid, Letterkenny, Donegal (2020).

Back to Top

Grace Haynes

Grace Haynes a is an Illustrator and arts Facilitator who graduated from the University of Ulster. Grace work is inspired by the natural world and drawing on a love of nature. She is passionate about working and engaging young people in the arts.

Email: gracemzhaynes@gmail.com

Schools: St. Tiarnach's Primary School (Monaghan) 2022, Billis N.S (Cavan) 2022, Scoil Mhuire Ns (Cavan) 2022, St. Clare's Primary School (Cavan) 2022

Back to Top

Teresa McGowan

Teresa is an Assistant Principal II and develops curricular drama for primary and secondary level. She has experience in drama education, community drama and managing arts and educational events. She directs two county-wide school drama festivals.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (Use FAO Teresa McGowan as subject line)

Schools: Finn Valley College, Donegal (2020); Scoil Iosagain, Donegal (2020)

Back to Top

Leanne McLaughlin

Leanne is a visual artist who graduated from the University of Ulster. Leanne has worked on projects ranging from visual art to fine art sculptures and public art. She designs workshops concerned with social and cultural inclusion.

Email: leanne-mclaughlin@hotmail.com

Schools: Kilkenny National School, Donegal (2021); Mulroy College, Donegal (2021); Pobalscoil Ghaoth Dobhair, Donegal (2021); Scoil Mhuire, Donegal (2021); The Ursuline College, Sligo (2021); St. Joseph's Special School, Sligo (2021); Colaiste Mhuire, Sligo (2020); Youthreach Gortahork, Donegal (2020).

Back to Top

Diarmaid O'Meara

Diarmaid worked as a professional dancer for many years and currently teaches ballet and creative dance in Buncrana and Letterkenny, as well as guest-teaching nationally. Diarmaid also teaches 1st class in Scoil √çosag√°in, Buncrana.

Email: diarmaidomeara@hotmail.com

Schools: Errigal College, Donegal (2021); Crana College, Donegal (2021)

Back to Top

Siobh√°n Shiels

Siobh√°n is a performer, composer, tutor and facilitator. Her debut album made critics‚Äô choice for the top twenty albums of 2019. She composes for film and TV, and delivers music sessions with adults with Intellectual Disabilities for the HSE.

Email: siobhanshiels@gmail.com

Schools: Donagh N.S, Donegal (2021); St Bernadette's Special School, Donegal (2021); Abbey Vocational School, Donegal (2020); Scoil Naomh Colmcille, Carndonagh, Donegal (2020); Scoil Mhuire, Donegal (2020)

Back to Top

Region 2: West (Galway, Mayo & Roscommon)

Ceara Conway

Ceara Conway is a visual artist and singer with 15 years‚Äô experience producing art works that utilise elements such as live singing, film and visual art. She is Artist in Residence with Ormston House and Artist in Schools coord with the Clare Arts Office

Email: conwayceara@gmail.com

Schools: Colaiste Na Coiribe, Galway (2021); Scoil Phobail Mhic Dara, Cara, Galway (2020); Scoil Chriost Ri, Cloughleigh, Ennis, Clare (2020); New Quay National School, Burren, Clare (2020); Scoil Mhuire, Galway (2020).

Back to Top

Sybil Curley

Sybil Curley is a registered Architect whose practice includes architecture, interior design, exhibition design, and design education. She is passionate about working with children and young people to explore their innate creativity.

Email: sybcurley@gmail.com

Schools: Bushypark N.S, Galway (2021); Ballyglass NS, Ardrahan, Galway (2020).

Back to Top

Mary Curran

Mary Curran is the director and French horn player of the WhistleBlast Quartet. She has developed workshops for school children, youth orchestras, and teachers and for multiple disability levels within the special needs sector.

Email: whistleblastquartet@gmail.com

Schools: Letterfrack NS, Galway (2020); St Angela's N.S, Mayo (2020)

Back to Top

Dee Deegan

Deirdre is a multidisciplinary artist with an interest in alternative photography and printmaking, bookmaking, altered book art, design and installation. Deirdre has lectured in contemporary art at GMIT and also has established the Galway Art Academy.

Email: dee@galwayartacademy.com

Schools: St Nicholas National School, Galway (2021); St. John The Apostle, Knocknacarra National School, Galway (2021); St. Patrick's Primary School, Galway (2021); Cuan na Gaillimhe CNS, Knocknacarra, Galway (2020); Merlin College, Doughiska, Galway (2020)

Back to Top

Alice Dixon

Alice is a socially engaged visual artist and educator based in County Mayo. Her practice is mostly participatory and collaborative. She also holds over 10 years experience in Community Development in a variety of roles, eg. Youth Project Co-ordinator and currently Creative Ireland Projects Manager with Leitrim Arts Office. She is very passionate about delivering creative experiences to children and young people.

Email: alicedixon234@gmail.com

Schools: Kiltimagh Youthreach Centre, Kiltimagh, Mayo (2021); St Pauls NS, Castlebar, Mayo (2021); Ballyvary Central NS, Mayo (2021).

Phillida Eves

Phillida is a multi-sensory artist. She specialises in creating musical multi-sensory experiences and performances collaboratively for and with children on the autistic spectrum and children with complex needs.

Email: phillidaevescreative@gmail.com

Schools: Lakeview School Galway, Galway (2021); St Joseph's Special School, Galway (2020).

Back to Top

Donna Gilligan

Donna is an educational facilitator; creating and providing a range of workshops, events, and educational programmes to a broad range of institutions. My expertise and themes for these include culture, heritage, craft, design, and literature.

Email: scealheritage@gmail.com

Schools: SN Padraig Naofa, Castlerea, Roscommon (2020); Our Lady Of Mount Carmel N.S. Rooskey, Leitrim (2020).

Back to Top

Valerie Haslam

Valerie is a professional in visual communications, design and branding. She handles the services of a full design studio from project management, client liaison, and design concept through design development, artwork, production and print management.

Email: valerie.haslam@schema.ie

Schools: Blakestown Community School, Dublin (2021); Collinstown Park Community College, Dublin (2021); St. Mochta‚Äôs N.S, Dublin (2021); St. Paul's School, Roscommon (2021); Castlerea Community School, Roscommon (2021); St Brigid's Primary School, The Coombe, Dublin 8 (2020).

Back to Top

Deirbhle Healy

Deirbhle is a Professional Musical Theatre Artist specialising in Music, Drama and Dance. She also studied Classical Music and Group and Community Music Education. She is passionate about bringing arts education to children and young people.

Email: dhealy@arasinisgluaire.ie

Schools: Barnatra National School, Mayo (2021); Gaelscoil Uileog De B√∫rca, Mayo (2021); Sn Dhumhna Thuama, Mayo (2021).

Back to Top

Jojo Hynes

Jojo Hynes is an artist and educator with over ten years experience. She recently completed an artist residency by Bow Arts at RAW Labs in London. Her practice encompasses a wide range of media, including: fine art, digital arts and physical theatre.

Email: jojohynes@gmail.com

Schools: Archbishop McHale College, Tuam, Galway (2020); Castlehacket National School, Tuam, Galway (2020); Belmont NS,Tuam, Galway (2020).

Back to Top

Joanna McGlynn

Joanna is a visual artist.

Email: joannamcglynnca@gmail.com

Schools: Gardenfield National School, Galway (2021); Sylane National School, Galway (2021); Youthreach Tuam, Galway (2020); Cloghans Hill NS, Tuam, Galway (2020).

Back to Top

Isb√©al Nic Aoidh

Isb√©al has a degree in Fine Art from GMIT Cluain Mhuire, she exhibits regularly with Six Degrees West/6 Ch√©im Thiar a group of fellow graduates. She has also been teaching for many years and places a big emphasis on student engagement with the arts.

Email: isbealnicaoidh@hotmail.com

Schools: Scoil Iognaid, Galway (2020).

Back to Top

Christopher O‚ÄôMalley

Chris was a school teacher and now manages the Westport Festival of Chamber Music. He also visits various schools in Co. Mayo delivering workshops on various styles of music. He spent many years as Director of the Irish Arts Foundation in the UK and returned to Ireland in 2018.

Email: christopheromalley@hotmail.com

Schools: Shraigh N.S. (Mayo) 2022, Dooagh National School (Mayo) 2022, Scoil Naomh Bhr√≠de (Mayo) 2022

Back to Top

Damien O'Reilly

Damien is a Primary teacher with a Post Grad in Education. He has over 15 years of traditional music education. He is a solo artist who released an album recently and is the chairman/musical director of the Corofin Traditional Festival.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (Putting FAO Damien O'Reilly in the subject)

Schools: Ballymana National School, Galway (2021); Tierneevin National School, Galway (2021).

Back to Top

Catherine Sheridan

Catherine is a professional theatre and arts practitioner. Specialising in drama education, youth theatre, directing, writing, consultancy and CPD. Trained in Drama & Theatre Studies UCD, NUIM and Suzuki & Viewpoints in SITI (USA).

Email: drama.works@hotmail.com

Schools: Cloverhill N.S, Roscommon (2021); Holy Rosary College, Galway (2021); Kilglass N.S, Galway (2021); Killeeneen National School, Galway (2021); Lackagh N.S, Galway (2021); Radharc Na Mara, Galway (2021); Roscommon Town Youthreach, Roscommon (2021); St Annin's National School, Galway (2021); Trinity Primary School, Galway (2021); St Brigid's College, Loughrea, Galway (2020); Roscommon Community College, Roscommon (2020); Craughwell NS, Galway (2020); Clarin College, Galway (2020)

Region 3: Midlands (Laois, Longford, Offaly & Westmeath)

Aidan Byrne

Aidan Byrne is a multi-disciplinary artist and facilitator specializing in mosaic. Aidan has a Bachelor of Arts with honours degree in sculpture and has worked extensively on various community Art projects.

Email: aidan@makemosaic.ie

Schools: Ballymahon Vocational School, Longford (2021); St. Mary's N.S, Longford (2021); Cloneyhurke National School; Portarlington, Laois (2020); Curraghmore NS, Mullingar, Westmeath (2020).

Back to Top

Caroline Conway

Caroline Conway is a visual artist and facilitator who has developed a collaborative, multi-disciplinary practice to include moving image and performance. She has worked extensively in schools and is a tutor on the Teacher Artist Partnership CPD.

Email: carolinefconway@gmail.com

Schools: St Brigid's Special School, Mullingar, Westmeath (2020); St Joseph's NS, Tullamore, Offaly (2020); St Philomena's NS, Tullamore, Offaly (2020).

Back to Top

Monica de Bath

Monica is a bilingual artist and art educator that reimagines fragile habitats. PLOT / CEAPACH is presented at exhibitions and seminars. Interdisciplinary collaborations include Creative Rathangan Meitheal and Bealtaine Commission Award 2020.

Email: monicadebath@gmail.com

Schools: Scoil Mhuire, Kildare (2021); Gaelscoil Na Laochra, Birr, Offaly (2020).

Back to Top

Aideen McHugh

Aideen is an artist, designer and project manager who graduated with First Class Honours, Master of Arts in Interaction Design, 2016. Aideen graduated again with First Class Honours, a Higher Diploma in Arts in Digital Media Design.

Email: aideen.m.mchugh@gmail.com

Schools: Dysart National School, Westmeath (2021); St Joseph's Secondary School, Westmeath (2021); Timahoe N.S, Laois (2021); Ardscoil Phadraig, Longford (2021); Lanesborough Primary School, Longford (2021); Scoil Mhuire N.S, Longford (2021); Ballyleague N.S, Roscommon (2021); Scoil Phadraig Naofa BNS, Mountmellick, Laois (2020); Newtown National School, Crettyyard, Laois (2020); Scoil Bhr√≠de, Kildare (2020)

Back to Top

Niamh O'Donohue

Niamh has a background in New Product Development, Marketing. She has 16 years‚Äô experience as a primary school teacher and holds an MA in Dance. Her creative practice promotes the importance of collaborating with pupils in curriculum design.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (putting FAO Niamh O'Donohue in the subject)

Back to Top

Region 4: Mid-East (Kildare, Louth, Meath & Wicklow)

Rebecca Blake

Rebecca‚Äôs creative practice is focused on engaging people in art, architecture and place-making. She collaborates with artists and young people to design creative experiences that inspire a greater sense of identity, ownership and citizenship.

Email: ruby.rebeccablake@gmail.com

Schools: St Fergals Ns Bray, Wicklow (2021); Scoil Chaoimh√≠n Naofa, Wicklow (2021); New Court School, Bray, Wicklow (2021); Colaiste Chraobh Abhann, Kilcoole, Wicklow (2020); St Laurence PS, Greystones, Wicklow (2020)

Back to Top

Kwasie Boyce

Kwasie Boyce founder and artistic director of M.A.D Youth Theatre in Dundalk. Co Louth. Kwasie have been serving his community in the formal and non formal settings as a freelance drama facilitator and arts coordinator for the past 12 years

Email:Kwasieboyce@yahoo.com

Schools: Col√°iste Ch√∫ Chulainn (Louth) 2022, St. Joseph's N.S. (Louth) 2022

Back to Top

Aisling Byrne

Aisling is a theatre artist and educator who has worked extensively in the fields of arts and disability, community drama facilitation and socially engaged theatre practice. Aisling is the Artistic Director of both Run of the Mill Theatre, and award-winning theatre collective Talking Shop Ensemble.

Email: byrnea11@tcd.ie

Schools: St Kevin's College, Dunlavin, Wicklow (2020); Ashbourne Community National School, Meath (2020); Confey Community College, Leixlip, Kilare (2020); Kildare Town Educate Together, Kildare (2020).

Back to Top

Juley-Ann Collins

Juley-Ann is an arts manager, producer and curator working across multi-disciplinary arts settings such as festivals, production companies, venues and local authorities. This includes co-ordinating small to large scale partnership national and international projects with multiple funders including The Arts Council and Creative Europe.

Email: juleyanncollins@gmail.com

Schools: Marymount N.S (Louth) 2022, St. Mary's Parish Primary School (Louth) 2022

Back to Top

Cathy Devis

Cathy is an English and Drama teacher in Newpark Comprehensive School. In the last sixteen years, she has developed a thriving, progressive and creative drama department and has been responsible for curriculum development in the area of drama. She chairs the school arts committee.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (Putting FAO Cathy Devis in the subject)

Schools: Greystones Community College Etb, Wicklow (2021)

Back to Top

Clair Farley

Clair is a primary teacher and drama therapist. She works with teenagers and adults with mental health issues and intellectual disabilities and uses the arts in helping to facilitate change. Clair has a keen interest in Irish Traditional music.

Email: farleyc@tcd.ie

Back to Top

Helen Flanagan

Helen is a filmmaker and writer with a parallel practice based in performance and live events. She regularly works with children facilitating film-making, creative writing, shadow puppetry, folklore and creative storytelling workshops.

Email: helenflanagan@me.com

Schools: Educate Together Secondary School, Wicklow (2021); St Patricks National School, Wicklow (2021)

Back to Top

Declan Gorman

Declan Gorman is a playwright and performer specialising in community-engaged arts and education. His plays tour widely in Ireland and abroad. He is a tutor with New York University Educational Drama and a trainer on the Teacher-Artist Partnership CPD.

Email: declangorman@yahoo.co.uk

Schools: St Michael's NS, Castleblaney, Monaghan (2020); Dublin North East Educate Together, Dublin 13 (2020); Lusk Senior National School, Dublin (2020); Inver College, Monaghan (2020).

Back to Top

Orlagh Meegan Gallagher

Orlagh is a visual artist specialising in painting and textiles. She works with community groups, in health settings and in schools focusing on sharing her practice as a seascape artist in order to facilitate meaningful engagement with art.

Email: orlaghmeegangallagher@gmail.com

Schools: Col√°iste R√≠s Secondary School (Louth) 2021, St Louis Secondary School (Louth) 2021, Scoil Rois (Monaghan) 2022

Laura N√≠ Fhlaibh√≠n

Laura is a visual artist.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (Putting FAO Laura N√≠ Fhlaibh√≠n in subject)

Schools: All Saints' N.S, Wicklow (2021); Carnew National School, Wicklow (2021); Gaelscoil An Inbhir Mh√≥ir, Arklow, Wicklow (2020); SS Michael and Peters Junior School, Arklow, Wicklow (2020); Colaiste an Atha, Wexford (2020); Ramsgrange Community School, Wexford (2020).

Alexandra Rosiak

Alex Rosiak has an M.A. Degree in English Philology and Theatre Studies from Wroclaw University (Poland). She is an experienced theatre director, producer and drama facilitator. Since 2009 Alex has been working in Riverbank Arts Centre in Newbridge.

Email: aleksandrarosiak@hotmail.com

Schools: Kilberry N.S, Kildare (2021); Scoil Ch√≥ca Naofa, Kildare (2021).

Pat Ryan

Pat is a storyteller, writer and educator based in Belfast who works all over Ireland and Europe. He tells traditional folktales and has led many projects with musicians, visual artists, other writers and tellers, and footballers. His most recent book is Story Listening and Experience.

Email: PRyan1984@gmail.com

Schools: Bellurgan National School (Louth) 2022

Back to Top

Bex Shelford

Bex is an artist and illustrator in Dublin. She has two series of artworks in galleries in Dublin and around Ireland. She also wrote and illustrated a children‚Äôs art journal called ‚ÄúBe An Irish Explorer‚Äù which was published by Gill in April 2019.

Email: bexshelford@gmail.com

Schools: St Peter's Primary School, Bray, Wicklow (2020); Woodbrook College, Bray, Wicklow (2020)

Tunde Toth

Tunde is a visual artist.

Email: creativeschools@artscouncil.ie (Putting FAO Tunde Toth in subject)

Region 5: Dublin

Sharon Carty

A former teacher, Irish mezzo-soprano Sharon subsequently studied singing at the RIAM Dublin and the MDW in Vienna. Upon completion she joined the Oper Frankfurt Opera Studio. An Artistic Partner to the Irish National Opera, she is passionate about the power of music in having a positive impact on children and young people.

Email: mail@sharoncarty.com

Schools: St Peter's College, Meath (2021); Goatstown Educate Together Secondary School, Dublin 14 (2020); St Joseph of Cluny, Killiney, Dublin (2020); Stratford National School, Rathgar, Dublin 6 (2020).

Back to Top

Anne Cradden

Anne Cradden is a visual artist who works in sculpture and drawing. Over the past few years, she has been working with children and young people to develop their experiences of contemporary art and art making. She is currently artist in residence at the Room 13 studio at Tyrellstown ETNS in Dublin 15.

Email: annecradden@gmail.com

Schools: Holy Spirit Girls National School, Dublin (2021); Scoil Chormaic Cns, Dublin (2021); St Oliver's National School, Louth (2021); Louth & Meath Education & Training Board (St Olivers Community), Louth (2021); Scoil Chaitriona Infants, Coolock, Dublin 5 (2020); St Michael's House Special School, Baldoyle, Dublin 13 (2020); Youthreach Transition Centre, Dublin 1 (2020).

Brian is a visual artist/educator with a background in photography and film-making. His work explores our relationship to landscape, natural history and the built environment. He also runs regular photography/art workshops and residencies with children and young people.

Email: bpcregan@gmail.com

Schools: Maynooth Community College, Kildare (2021); Robertstown N.S, Kildare (2021); Kylemore College, Ballyfermot, Dublin 10 (2020); Ballyfermot Youthreach, Dublin 10 (2020).

Heather Gray is an artist working with drawing, sculpture, and installation. Heather facilitates art workshops and classes as well as creating large scale collaborative art projects with the public. Heather is a member of A4 Sounds art studios.

Email: Heathergray.art@gmail.com

Fiona is an arts educator with a background in visual arts, specialising in Textiles. Fiona uses art as a way to explore processes that allow young people access to new experiences and ways of understanding and expressing themselves.

Email: fiharrington@gmail.com

Mirjam works as an artist with children and adults in schools, community settings and on collaborative art projects. She has a degree from NCAD in fine art. Her studio practice involves mixed media and crafts (painting and textile crafts).

Bethan is a visual artist practitioner with experience of working in a variety of school, hospital and community settings. Bethan‚Äôs creative practice is rooted in encouraging each person to explore and express their own unique creative potential.
